alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 3:47PM AKST until February 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. * WHERE...Susitna Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Reduced visibilities to as low as one half mile are also expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow is expected to continue across the Susitna Valley through the overnight hours. Snowfall rates are expected to diminish Tue morning and largely end by midday Tuesday. The heaviest snow accumulations are expected over the northern valley, where an additional 6 to 12 inches are likely along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna north. Lesser snow amounts are expected across the southern Susitna Valley, including Willow with an additional 3 to 5 inches of snow expected.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
